body.title: No evidence Nicola Bulley fell into river, says sister
body.description: Police believe Nicola Bulley fell into the river but her sister says there is "no evidence" of that.

body.title: Chris Parry and Andrew Bagshaw's bodies recovered in prisoner swap - Ukraine
body.description: Kyiv says Chris Parry and Andrew Bagshaw's remains were handed over as part of a prisoner swap.

body.title: Kuenssberg: Truss returns - and it could be trouble for PM
body.description: Truss returns to the political fray via a newspaper comment piece - and the PM can't afford to ignore her.

body.title: China urges calm over 'spy' balloon in US airspace
body.description: The US condemns China's intrusion as the Pentagon reports a second Chinese balloon over Latin America.

body.title: Teenager dies after shark attack in Australian river
body.description: The 16-year-old girl was thought to have been swimming in the Swan River, Western Australia Police say.

body.title: Tyre Nichols: Sixth police officer fired
body.description: Preston Hemphill violated multiple rules, including stun gun deployment regulations, police say.

body.title: Eurovision 2023: John Lydon fails in bid to be Ireland's act for Liverpool
body.description: Public Image Ltd, which John Lydon formed after the Sex Pistols split, had hoped to go to the song contest.

body.title: NHS chief: Strikes making hospital bosses restless
body.description: With NHS England about to enter its biggest round of strikes, leaders say clearing backlogs will be difficult.

body.title: Japan PM fires aide over derogatory LGBT remarks
body.description: Masayoshi Arai was dismissed after reportedly saying he would not want to live next to same-sex couples.

body.title: Dominic Raab should be suspended, says ex-Conservative chairman
body.description: Jake Berry argues MPs and ministers should be treated like "anyone else".

body.title: Lord of the Rings tells Brighton bin firm to change name
body.description: Brighton waste company Lord of the Bins say they face the prospect of spending thousands to rebrand.

body.title: Cost of living: 109-year-old bakery closes due to rising costs
body.description: Paul Noakes, 76, said costs have forced him to retire and close his family business.

body.title: 'I'm obsessed with my smart meter'
body.description: Smart meter in home displays can be a useful budgeting tool but for some they become a source of stress.

body.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
body.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

body.title: What is a recession and how could it affect me?
body.description: Britain's economy is expected to shrink in 2023, and grow only slowly in the following period.

body.title: 'Our mortgage got so high we put off having a baby'
body.description: Homeowners tell the BBC they are being hit harder by rising mortgage rates than soaring fuel and food bills.

body.title: King Charles III: Warm space opens at Highgrove House
body.description: The royal Gloucestershire residence is open for locals to use as a warm space until the middle of March.

body.title: Disabled woman offered £10k for energy bills but refuses
body.description: Anne Vivian-Smith is disabled and struggles to pay her bills - her story prompted a generous donation from one reader.

body.title: Cost of living: Zero-hour jobs and the impact on mental health
body.description: Aqibur says getting a stable job felt like a weight off his shoulders after years of uncertainty.

body.title: UK interest rates: How high could they go and how the rise affects you?
body.description: The Bank of England has increased interest rates to 4%, pushing the cost of some mortgages up further.

body.title: Woman buys narrowboat to get on property ladder
body.description: Artist Elizabeth Earle, from Warwickshire, bought her first narrowboat using her overdraft.

body.title: Cost of living with food allergies becoming 'unbearable'
body.description: Prices of supermarket staples are rising at the fastest rate in decades, hitting "free from" shoppers hard.

body.title: Over-50s at work: 'You feel your usefulness has passed'
body.description: A survey suggests applicants are right when they say employers are less open to hiring older workers.

body.title: Cost of living: Woman puts cat down jumper to keep warm
body.description: Sharon Hearn says she can only afford to heat her home for two hours a day.

body.title: Australia radioactive capsule: Missing material more common than you think
body.description: The world was fascinated by a capsule in Australia - but hundreds of radioactive items go missing each year.

body.title: Delilah: Song ban opens debate on depictions of violence against women
body.description: Comparisons have been made over how gendered violence is shown across different artforms.

body.title: China balloon: Could it have been blown off course as Beijing claims?
body.description: Wind speed and weather data has been used to track its possible path.

body.title: Independent Venue Week: The history of rock is written on these walls
body.description: From graffiti to guest books, five venues share the scribblings of rock and pop's biggest stars.

body.title: Ukraine war: How two mothers retrieved their dead sons from the battlefield
body.description: With little help from the military to bring the soldiers' bodies home, two mothers took charge themselves.

body.title: Green expectations: Is the party finally breaking through in England and Wales?
body.description: The Green Party is hoping council gains will pave the way for a second MP at Westminster.

body.title: Pope Francis in South Sudan: The Catholic pilgrims who walked nine days to Juba
body.description: "When the spirit is with you, you do not get tired," says one South Sudanese woman after walking 300km.

body.title: 'I escaped abusive jungle cult - then rescued my son'
body.description: When Yisrael Amir fled the isolated sect, he brought with him tales of control, abuse and rape.

body.title: Grammy Awards: Domi & JD Beck on 'crazy' nomination
body.description: Domi & JD Beck have been signed for less than a year but are up for two of the prestigious awards.

body.title: Week in pictures: 28 January - 3 February 2023
body.description: A selection of powerful news photographs taken around the world this week.

body.title: Padayappa: The friendly India elephant whose fame is a curse
body.description: Padayappa has long been a fan favourite in India's Kerala state. So why is he controversial now?

body.title: Everton 1-0 Arsenal: James Tarkowski scores winner in Sean Dyche's first game
body.description: James Tarkowski's second-half goal gives new Everton manager Sean Dyche enjoys a dream start as a much-improved side stun Premier League leaders Arsenal at a raucous Goodison Park.

body.title: Six Nations 2023: James Lowe scores 86-metre try for Ireland against Wales
body.description: James Lowe intercepts a Wales pass and runs in a try from 86 metres as Ireland dominate their Six Nations meeting in Cardiff.

body.title: Six Nations 2023: Caelan Doris gives Ireland early lead against Wales
body.description: Ireland's Caelan Doris scores the first try of this year's Six Nations to give his side an early lead against Wales.

body.title: Conor McGregor offers £500,000 to help stage Taylor-Serrano fight at Croke Park
body.description: Conor McGregor offers to provide £500,000 to pay for the "extra security bill" to allow Katie Taylor's world title rematch with Amanda Serrano to be staged at Croke Park.
